gov.anl.ipns.ViewTools.Components.Transparency
Class SelectionOverlay

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          javax.swing.JComponent
              javax.swing.JPanel
                  gov.anl.ipns.ViewTools.Components.Transparency.OverlayJPanel
                      gov.anl.ipns.ViewTools.Components.Transparency.SelectionOverlay
All Implemented Interfaces:
IPreserveState, IOverlay, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible
public class SelectionOverlay
extends OverlayJPanel

This class allows users to select a region for calculation purposes. Three types of regions may currently be selected: point, box, and circle. The selected region will initially show up in white. Since this class extends an OverlayJPanel, which extends a JPanel, this class is already serializable.

See Also:
Serialized Form

Constant Field Values

SELECTED_REGIONS

public static final java.lang.String SELECTED_REGIONS
"Selected Regions" - This constant String is a key for referencing the state information about which regions have been selected. The value that this key references is a Vector of Region instances.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

SELECTION_COLOR

public static final java.lang.String SELECTION_COLOR
"Selection Color" - This constant String is a key for referencing the state information about the color of the selection outlines. The value that this key references is of type Color.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

OPACITY

public static final java.lang.String OPACITY
"Opacity" - This constant String is a key for referencing the state information about the invisibility of the selection outline. The value that this key references is a primative float on the range [0,1], with 0 = transparent, 1 = opaque.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

EDITOR_BOUNDS

public static final java.lang.String EDITOR_BOUNDS
"Editor Bounds" - This constant String is a key for referencing the state information about the size and bounds of the Selection Editor window. The value that this key references is a Rectangle. The Rectangle contains the dimensions for the editor.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

setOpacity

public void setOpacity(float value)
This method sets the opaqueness of the selection. Values will fall in the interval [0,1], with 1 being opaque, and 0 being transparent.

Parameters:
value - - on interval [0,1]

kill

public void kill()
This method is called by to inform the overlay that it is no longer needed. In turn, the overlay closes all windows created by it before closing.

Specified by:
kill in class OverlayJPanel

disableSelection

public void disableSelection(java.lang.String[] select_names)
This method will disable the selections and cursors included in the names list. Names are defined by static Strings in the SelectionJPanel class.

Parameters:
select_names - List of selection names defined by SelectionJPanel class.
